job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture. You will collaborate with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure systems, applications, and cloud environments are secure, reliable, and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and execute mitigation plans.
  • Architect and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture, ensuring secure design and development practices.
  • Monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, incidents, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures on AWS, Azure, or GCP for scalable, compliant deployments.
  • Build and secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes using enforced security baselines.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems for infrastructure and applications.
  • Improve system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance across critical workloads.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development, automation, and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, process improvements, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security, performance, and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with strong security exposure.
  • Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions).
  • Expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP cloud platforms with secure architecture focus.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Strong understanding of networking technologies (LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers).
  • Knowledge of security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Experience with monitoring/logging tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM).
  • Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash, Shell).
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and collaboration abilities to influence engineering teams.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Lead cybersecurity and DevSecOps practices to modernize pipelines and ensure secure cloud environments. Requires expertise in Terraform, AWS, and Kubernetes.

job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

At 2Base, we are rebuilding the Business Analyst function into a world-class, product-minded, clarity-driven team. This role is not a documentation role, not a screen updater role, and not a support role. This is a core Business Analyst position responsible for functional modeling, system reasoning, requirement clarity, and building the foundation for correct development.

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be the functional brain of the project. You will ensure that the right problem is understood, broken down, analyzed, validated, clarified, communicated, and owned end-to-end. You will drive requirement precision, reduce rework, and enable confident and aligned delivery across teams.

Key Responsibilities - Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly. - Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement. - Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding. - Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies. - Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations. - Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute. - Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviors, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies. - Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria. - Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use. - Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding. - Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria. - Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately. - Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly. - Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development. - Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability. - Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Required Skills & Experience - Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking. - Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic. - Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications. - Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity. - Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity. - Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams. - Understanding of API behaviors, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions. - Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions. - Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage. - Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs. - Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers. - Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication. - Candidates must align with 2Base’s structured thinking, clarity-driven culture, and transformation of the BA function.

Minimum Qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field - 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst - Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments - Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems - Ability to run independent client workshops - Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits - A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst drives functional modeling and requirement clarity, collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure precise, testable outputs for scalable product development.

job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented
  • Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation
  • Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them
  • Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams
  • Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams
  • Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle
  • Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements
  • Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation
  • Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines
  • Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details
  • Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation
  • Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements

Required Skills and Experience

  • 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles
  • Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation
  • Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control
  • Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly
  • Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes
  • Experience with project management systems and documentation tools
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel
  • Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
  • 1 to 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com
summary: Translates business requirements into structured documentation for software development. Ensures clarity, traceability, and alignment across teams.

job_description:
Senior Architect - Software

At Fingent, we believe that technology can make a meaningful difference to the lives around us. We create and provide software that is beautiful, usable, and compelling to solve complex business challenges. We nurture smart people who bring out the best in themselves, their peers, and their clients. We are looking for an experienced Senior Techno-Functional Project Manager to join our Project Management Office (PMO) and help us continue our mission.

Role Overview

We are seeking a Technical Architect who brings a system-wide perspective across backend, frontend, mobile, infrastructure, data, and operations—and who can connect the dots end-to-end for an on-demand platform. You will partner closely with the leadership team to shape how the platform is built, evolved, operated, and augmented with AI over time. You will play a key role in moving the organization toward a pragmatic, AI-driven development and operations model, starting from the MVP and maturing iteratively.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design scalable, cloud-native architecture for real-time delivery operations (order management, dispatch, routing, tracking)
  • Mentor a high-performing engineering team
  • Own technical decisions on microservices architecture, databases, APIs, and integration patterns
  • Establish development practices, CI/CD pipelines, and operational excellence standards
  • Partner with product and business teams to translate requirements into technical solutions
  • Ensure system reliability, user experience, performance, and security at scale

Required Experience

  • 10+ years in software development with 3+ years in architect/principal engineer roles
  • Proven track record building real-time, high-transaction platforms (marketplace, logistics, or on-demand systems)
  • Deep expertise in distributed systems, microservices, event-driven architecture
  • Strong experience with cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP), containerization, and orchestration
  • Hands-on with modern tech stacks, AI-assisted development, and architecture decisions
  • Experience building and leading technical teams of 5–10 engineers

Preferred Skills

  • Prior work on delivery, logistics, or two-sided marketplace platforms
  • Expertise in geospatial systems, routing algorithms, and real-time tracking
  • Knowledge of mobile backend architectures and API design
  • Experience with ML/AI integration for demand forecasting or route optimization

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@fingent.com.
summary: Senior Architect designs cloud-native, real-time systems with AI integration, leading teams and ensuring scalable solutions for on-demand platforms.

SMARTHMS & SOLUTIONS (P) Ltd SBC 14, -2 Floor, Thejaswini Building and Ground Floor, Chandragiri Building, Technopark Phase 1, 695581 https://shmsolutions.in

Junior Linux System Administrator | Freshers - Closing Date: 30, Mar 2026 - Job Published: 13, Feb 2026 - Contact Email: careers@shmsolutions.in

Brief Description

We are looking for a Junior Linux System Administrator to support and maintain Linux-based infrastructure and assist in implementing security controls. This role is ideal for someone eager to build a strong foundation in system administration, infrastructure operations, and security best practices.

Key Responsibilities

Infrastructure Support

  • Assist in maintaining and monitoring Linux-based servers
  • Support on-premise and cloud infrastructure (basic exposure)
  • Monitor server health, disk usage, CPU, memory, and uptime
  • Assist with application deployment, configuration, and backups
  • Perform basic troubleshooting for server and infrastructure issues
  • Maintain infrastructure documentation and system records

Network & Systems

  • Support networking fundamentals including IP addressing, DNS, and firewalls
  • Assist in managing SSL certificates, VPN access, and basic network security
  • Coordinate with senior engineers for system upgrades and changes

Security Responsibilities

  • Assist in implementing system hardening and security best practices
  • Monitor system logs and alerts for potential security issues
  • Support patching and vulnerability remediation
  • Assist in managing user access, roles, and permissions
  • Help with backup verification and disaster recovery activities

Compliance & Best Practices

  • Follow defined security policies and operational procedures
  • Support internal and external audits when required
  • Ensure systems adhere to security and compliance guidelines

Preferred Skills & Qualifications

Required Skills

  • Basic to intermediate knowledge of Linux operating systems
  • Understanding of server concepts and system services
  • Basic knowledge of networking fundamentals (IP, DNS, ports, firewalls)
  • Awareness of information security fundamentals
  • Good problem-solving and troubleshooting skills

Work Flexibility & Support Requirements

  • Willingness to provide off-day, after-hours, or on-call support when required
  • Ability to respond to critical incidents and system outages
  • Flexible mindset to support infrastructure operations in a 24×7 environment (rotational / need-based)

Preferred Certifications (Not Mandatory)

  • RHCSA / RHCE
  • CCNA (Basic networking knowledge)
  • AWS / Azure Fundamentals

Experience

  • 0–2 years of experience in Infrastructure, Linux Administration, or Security
  • Fresh graduates with strong Linux fundamentals are encouraged to apply

Career Growth Opportunity

  • Opportunity to grow into DevOps, Cloud, or Security roles based on interest and performance
  • Exposure to real-world production environments and enterprise systems
  • Continuous learning through hands-on experience and mentorship

What We Offer

  • Hands-on experience with Linux production servers
  • Structured learning and mentorship
  • Stable and security-focused working environment
  • Clear technical growth path
summary: Junior Linux System Administrator role supporting infrastructure, security, and compliance. Ideal for freshers to build foundational skills with growth into DevOps or Cloud roles.
